result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel R Deleon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Submit a DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.
Pay all costs and surcharges. At a rate of $40.00 per month commencing April 10, 2016.  If not paid, convert to civil judgment.
AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.  Maintain absolute sobriety to be monitored by random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: At a rate of four (4) hours per month.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Miguel R Deleon in court with attorney Matthew Shawn Mayer.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Miguel R Deleon in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Miguel R Deleon in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Miguel R Deleon not in court.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 9/22/15 @ 1:30 pm
